member.name: T:Ressy.CodePage
member.summary: Code page identifier that specifies the encoding of text in a resource.

member.name: M:Ressy.CodePage.FromEncoding(System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Creates a code page identifier based on the specified encoding.

member.name: T:Ressy.HighLevel.Icons.IconExtensions
member.summary: Extensions for for working with icon resources.

member.name: M:Ressy.HighLevel.Icons.IconExtensions.RemoveIcon(Ressy.PortableExecutable)
member.summary: Removes all existing icon and icon group resources.

member.name: M:Ressy.HighLevel.Icons.IconExtensions.SetIcon(Ressy.PortableExecutable,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Adds or overwrites icon and icon group resources based on the specified ICO file stream.
member.remarks: Consider calling first to remove redundant icon and icon group resources.

member.name: M:Ressy.HighLevel.Icons.IconExtensions.SetIcon(Ressy.PortableExecutable,System.String)
member.summary: Adds or overwrites icon and icon group resources based on the specified ICO file.
member.remarks: Consider calling first to remove redundant icon and icon group resources.

member.name: T:Ressy.HighLevel.Manifests.ManifestExtensions
member.summary: Extensions for for working with manifest resources.

member.name: M:Ressy.HighLevel.Manifests.ManifestExtensions.ReadAsManifest(Ressy.Resource,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Reads the specified resource as as a manifest resource and decodes its data to an XML text string.

member.name: M:Ressy.HighLevel.Manifests.ManifestExtensions.TryGetManifest(Ressy.PortableExecutable,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Gets the manifest resource and reads its data as an XML text string. Returns null if the resource doesn't exist.
member.remarks: If there are multiple manifest resources, this method retrieves the one with the lowest ordinal name (ID), giving preference to resources in the neutral language. If there are no matching resources, this method retrieves the first manifest resource it finds.

member.name: M:Ressy.HighLevel.Manifests.ManifestExtensions.GetManifest(Ressy.PortableExecutable,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Gets the manifest resource and reads its data as an XML text string.
member.remarks: If there are multiple manifest resources, this method retrieves the one with the lowest ordinal name (ID), giving preference to resources in the neutral language. If there are no matching resources, this method retrieves the first manifest resource it finds.

member.name: M:Ressy.HighLevel.Manifests.ManifestExtensions.SetManifest(Ressy.PortableExecutable,System.String,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Adds or overwrites an manifest resource with the specified XML text string.

member.name: T:Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.FileFlags
member.summary: Flags associated with a portable executable file.

member.name: F:Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.FileFlags.None
member.summary: File does not have any special flags.

member.name: F:Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.FileFlags.Debug
member.summary: File contains debugging information or is compiled with debugging features enabled.

member.name: F:Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.FileFlags.InfoInferred
member.summary: File's version structure was created dynamically; therefore, some of the members in this structure may be empty or incorrect.

member.name: F:Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.FileFlags.Patched
member.summary: File has been modified and is not identical to the original shipping file of the same version number.

member.name: F:Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.FileFlags.PreRelease
member.summary: File is a development version, not a commercially released product.

member.name: F:Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.FileFlags.PrivateBuild
member.summary: File was not built using standard release procedures.

member.name: F:Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.FileFlags.SpecialBuild
member.summary: File was built by the original company using standard release procedures but is a variation of the normal file of the same version number.

member.name: T:Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.FileOperatingSystem
member.summary: Operating system for which a portable executable file was designed.

member.name: F:Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.FileOperatingSystem.Unknown
member.summary: Operating system for which the file was designed is unknown to the system.

member.name: F:Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.FileOperatingSystem.WindowsNT
member.summary: File was designed for Windows NT.

member.name: F:Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.FileOperatingSystem.PM16
member.summary: File was designed for 16-bit Presentation Manager.

member.name: F:Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.FileOperatingSystem.PM32
member.summary: File was designed for 32-bit Presentation Manager.

member.name: T:Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.FileSubType
member.summary: Sub-type of a portable executable file.

member.name: F:Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.FileSubType.Unknown
member.summary: File sub-type is unknown to the system.

member.name: F:Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.FileSubType.DriverVersionedPrinter
member.summary: File contains a versioned printer driver.

member.name: T:Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.FileType
member.summary: Type of a portable executable file.

member.name: F:Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.FileType.Unknown
member.summary: File type is unknown to the system.

member.name: T:Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.VersionAttributeName
member.summary: Encapsulates a name of an attribute stored inside a version info resource.

member.name: P:Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.VersionAttributeName.Comments
member.summary: Any additional information that should be displayed for diagnostic purposes.

member.name: P:Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.VersionAttributeName.CompanyName
member.summary: Identifies the company that produced the file.

member.name: P:Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.VersionAttributeName.FileDescription
member.summary: Describes the file in such a way that it can be presented to users. This string may be presented in a list box when the user is choosing files to install. For example, "Keyboard driver for AT-style keyboards" or "Microsoft Word for Windows".

member.name: P:Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.VersionAttributeName.FileVersion
member.summary: Identifies the version of this file. For example, this string could be "3.00A" or "5.00.RC2".

member.name: P:Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.VersionAttributeName.InternalName
member.summary: Identifies the file's internal name, if one exists. For example, this string could contain the module name for a DLL, a virtual device name for a Windows virtual device, or a device name for a MS-DOS device driver.

member.name: P:Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.VersionAttributeName.LegalCopyright
member.summary: Describes all copyright notices, trademarks, and registered trademarks that apply to the file. This should include the full text of all notices, legal symbols, copyright dates, trademark numbers, and so on. In English, this string should be in the format "Copyright Microsoft Corp. 1990 1994".

member.name: P:Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.VersionAttributeName.LegalTrademark
member.summary: Describes all trademarks and registered trademarks that apply to the file. This should include the full text of all notices, legal symbols, trademark numbers, and so on. In English, this string should be in the format "Windows is a trademark of Microsoft Corporation".

member.name: P:Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.VersionAttributeName.OriginalFilename
member.summary: Identifies the original name of the file, not including a path. This enables an application to determine whether a file has been renamed by a user. This name may not be MS-DOS 8.3-format if the file is specific to a non-FAT file system.

member.name: P:Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.VersionAttributeName.PrivateBuild
member.summary: Describes by whom, where, and why this private version of the file was built. For example, this string could be "Built by OSCAR on \OSCAR2".

member.name: P:Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.VersionAttributeName.ProductName
member.summary: Identifies the name of the product with which this file is distributed. For example, this string could be "Microsoft Windows".

member.name: P:Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.VersionAttributeName.ProductVersion
member.summary: Identifies the version of the product with which this file is distributed. For example, this string could be "3.00A" or "5.00.RC2".

member.name: P:Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.VersionAttributeName.SpecialBuild
member.summary: Describes how this version of the file differs from the normal version. For example, this string could be "Private build for Olivetti solving mouse problems on M250 and M250E computers".

member.name: T:Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.VersionAttributeTable
member.summary: Set of version attributes bound to a specific language and code page.

member.name: P:Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.VersionAttributeTable.CodePage
member.summary: Code page of the contained attributes.

member.name: T:Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.VersionExtensions
member.summary: Extensions for for working with version resources.

member.name: M:Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.VersionExtensions.ReadAsVersionInfo(Ressy.Resource)
member.summary: Reads the specified resource as as a version info resource and deserializes its data to the corresponding structural representation.

member.name: M:Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.VersionExtensions.TryGetVersionInfo(Ressy.PortableExecutable)
member.summary: Gets the version info resource and deserializes it. Returns null if the resource doesn't exist.
member.remarks: If there are multiple version info resources, this method retrieves the one with the lowest ordinal name (ID), giving preference to resources in the neutral language. If there are no matching resources, this method retrieves the first version info resource it finds.

member.name: M:Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.VersionExtensions.GetVersionInfo(Ressy.PortableExecutable)
member.summary: Gets the version info resource and deserializes it.
member.remarks: In case of multiple version info resources, this method retrieves the one with the lowest ordinal resource name in the neutral language. If there are no resources matching aforementioned criteria, this method retrieves the first version info resource it encounters.

member.name: M:Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.VersionExtensions.RemoveVersionInfo(Ressy.PortableExecutable)
member.summary: Removes all existing version info resources.

member.name: M:Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.VersionExtensions.SetVersionInfo(Ressy.PortableExecutable,Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.VersionInfo)
member.summary: Adds or overwrites a version info resource with the specified data.

member.name: M:Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.VersionExtensions.SetVersionInfo(Ressy.PortableExecutable,System.Action{Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.VersionInfoBuilder})
member.summary: Modifies the currently stored version info resource. If the version info resource doesn't exist, default values will be used for properties that haven't been provided.

member.name: T:Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.VersionInfo
member.summary: Version information associated with a portable executable file.

member.name: M:Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.VersionInfo.TryGetAttribute(Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.VersionAttributeName)
member.summary: Gets the value of the specified attribute. Returns null if the specified attribute doesn't exist in any of the attribute tables.
member.remarks: If version info includes multiple attribute tables, this method retrieves the value from the first table that contains the specified attribute, giving preference to tables in the neutral language.

member.name: M:Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.VersionInfo.GetAttribute(Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.VersionAttributeName)
member.summary: Gets the value of the specified attribute.
member.remarks: If version info includes multiple attribute tables, this method retrieves the value from the first table that contains the specified attribute, giving preference to tables in the neutral language.

member.name: M:Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.VersionInfoBuilder.SetAttribute(Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.VersionAttributeName,System.String,Ressy.Language,Ressy.CodePage)
member.summary: Sets version attribute in the table bound to the specified language and code page.

member.name: M:Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.VersionInfoBuilder.SetAttribute(Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.VersionAttributeName,System.String)
member.summary: Sets version attribute in all tables. If there are no existing tables, creates a new one bound to the neutral language and Unicode code page.

member.name: M:Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.VersionInfoBuilder.SetAll(Ressy.HighLevel.Versions.VersionInfo)
member.summary: Copies all data from an existing instance.

member.name: T:Ressy.Language
member.summary: Language identifier that specifies the locale of a resource or the text contained within it.

member.name: M:Ressy.Language.FromCultureInfo(System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Creates a language identifier from a culture descriptor.

member.name: P:Ressy.PortableExecutable.FilePath
member.summary: Path to the portable executable image file.

member.name: M:Ressy.PortableExecutable.GetResourceIdentifiers
member.summary: Gets the identifiers of all existing resources.

member.name: M:Ressy.PortableExecutable.TryGetResource(Ressy.ResourceIdentifier)
member.summary: Gets the raw binary data of the specified resource. Returns null if the resource does not exist.

member.name: M:Ressy.PortableExecutable.GetResource(Ressy.ResourceIdentifier)
member.summary: Gets the raw binary data of the specified resource.

member.name: M:Ressy.PortableExecutable.SetResource(Ressy.ResourceIdentifier,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Adds or overwrites the specified resource.

member.name: T:Ressy.Resource
member.summary: Resource stored in a portable executable image.

member.name: M:Ressy.Resource.ReadAsString(System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Decodes resource binary data as a text string. Uses Unicode (UTF-16) encoding by default.

member.name: T:Ressy.ResourceIdentifier
member.summary: Identifies a single resource stored in a portable executable image.

member.name: T:Ressy.ResourceName
member.summary: Name of a resource stored in a portable executable image.

member.name: P:Ressy.ResourceName.Code
member.summary: Integer code that corresponds to the resource name. Can be null in case of a non-ordinal resource name.

member.name: P:Ressy.ResourceName.Label
member.summary: Resource name label in the format of "#69" (for ordinal names) or "MyResource" (for non-ordinal names).

member.name: M:Ressy.ResourceName.ToPointer
member.summary: Marshals the value of this resource name to native memory for use with Windows API.

member.name: M:Ressy.ResourceName.FromCode(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates an ordinal resource name from an integer code.

member.name: M:Ressy.ResourceName.FromString(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a non-ordinal resource name from a string.

member.name: T:Ressy.ResourceType
member.summary: Type of a resource stored in a portable executable image.

member.name: P:Ressy.ResourceType.Code
member.summary: Integer code that corresponds to the resource type. Can be null in case of a non-ordinal resource type.

member.name: P:Ressy.ResourceType.Label
member.summary: Resource type label in the format of "#14 (GROUP_ICON)" (for standard ordinal types) or "#69" (for non-standard ordinal types) or "MyResource" (for non-ordinal types).

member.name: M:Ressy.ResourceType.ToPointer
member.summary: Marshals the value of this resource type to native memory for use with Windows API.

member.name: M:Ressy.ResourceType.FromCode(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates an ordinal resource type from an integer code.

member.name: M:Ressy.ResourceType.FromString(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a non-ordinal resource type from a string.
